page.name: Summarization (Video)
page.intro: How do the principles of deeper learning through questioning apply to writing instruction? Find out in this resource.
page.content:
The skill of summarizing is a good complement to questioning strategies. Here’s why:

Summarizing is an important part of comprehension; in fact, one good definition of comprehension is being able to explain the main ideas of a text. Summarizing is an active process in which readers ask themselves questions about the important ideas in a text.

Teachers ask higher-order questions and encourage students to self-question as a way of helping students identify the main ideas and think deeply about those ideas. As students answer questions, it’s important for them to pull the ideas together to form an understanding of the whole text. Summarizing fills that purpose.
